properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 9 at 7:14PM CST until January 13 at 3:49PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...
Skillet Fork River at Wayne City affecting Wayne and White
Counties

.Heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 3 days, with the highest
amounts expected Friday night into Saturday. River levels are forecast
to rise quickly along the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City, going
above flood stage on Saturday, and cresting in moderate flood level
around 19.5 feet on Sunday. Stay tuned to later forecasts as the
forecast crest will likely fluctuate some depending on exactly how
much and where the heaviest rainfall ends up.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City
* from Saturday afternoon to Monday afternoon.
* At  6:00 PM Thursday the stage was 5.6 feet.
* Flood Stage is 15.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Saturday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 19.5 feet by Sunday afternoon. The
river will fall below flood stage by late Monday morning.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
